New Records: Germany started Euro 2024 with a 5-1 win over Scotland, piling on the pain for the 10-man visitors.
Key Match Events: Jamal Musiala scored a goal and created another in a 2-0 opening 20 minutes for Germany
Ilkay Gündogan was fouled by Ryan Porteous, resulting in a red card and a penalty for Germany
Kai Havertz scored a penalty after Porteous' red card
Niclas Füllkrug made it 4-0 for Germany on 68 minutes
Emre Can added a fifth in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Clarke left Billy Gilmour on the bench, bringing in Callum McGregor for Scotland
Germany were expected to play with a 4-2-3-1 formation, which they recently switched to under Julian Nagelsmann
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Clarke rued Scotland's dismal Euro 2024 start
Germany's players took time to commune with the crowd after the match, taking in the ripples of the flag and parp of the horns
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Munich Football Arena was a giant lighted doughnut dumped down on the wooded fringes of Munich, with heaving human flesh blocking the concourses before the game
Scotland's players tracked gamely to the end, but will require a full mental and physical reset before their next match against Switzerland
